newsitem.title: USA: Fed to lower fees for electronic payment services.
newsitem.headline: Fed to lower fees for electronic payment services.

text.p: The Federal Reserve said on Wednesday it will lower in 1997 the fees charged for electronic transactions, which will save the banking sector $11.3 million next year.
The Fed said the lower fees were made possible by data processing consolidation within the Fed system.
New York Fed first vice president Ernest Patrikis said the system-wide consolidation of funds and Automated Clearing House (ACH) will be completed in early 1997.
"Consolidation of book-entry processing of securities will be completed early in 1998," Patrikis also said.

The reductions in fees charged by the Fed include a 10-percent reduction in the basic funds transfer fee, a 50-percent reduction in ACH premium surcharge, a 25-percent reduction in ACH transactions records, and the elimination of ACH file fee.
"We are able to substantially reduce our prices because consolidation is bringing down our costs," Patrikis added.
